extractions.description: This paper adopts the framework of generative flow networks (GFlowNets) to address challenges in phylogenetics, specifically focusing on parsimony-based and Bayesian phylogenetic inference. The authors introduce a novel model, PhyloGFN, and demonstrate its competitive performance against existing state-of-the-art methods on several datasets. The paper makes significant contributions to the field by offering effective solutions for sampling multimodal posterior distributions over tree topologies and evolutionary distances.

title.value: PhyloGFN: Phylogenetic Inference with Generative Flow Networks
title.justification: The title should clearly reflect the main topic and the innovative method introduced in the paper, which is PhyloGFN for phylogenetic inference using generative flow networks.
title.quote: PhyloGFN: Phylogenetic Inference with Generative Flow Networks

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results, comparisons with other methods, and performance evaluations on multiple datasets, reflecting its empirical nature.
type.quote: We demonstrate that our amortized posterior sampler, PhyloGFN, produces diverse and high-quality evolutionary hypotheses on real benchmark datasets.

research_field.justification: The paper leverages generative flow networks (GFlowNets), which are a deep learning approach, for phylogenetic inference tasks in computational biology.
research_field.quote: In this paper, we adopt the framework of generative flow networks (GFlowNets) to tackle two core problems in phylogenetics.

sub_research_field.justification: The primary application and context of this deep learning research are within phylogenetics, a branch of computational biology.
sub_research_field.quote: Phylogenetics is a branch of computational biology that studies the evolutionary relationships among biological entities.

name.justification: PhyloGFN is the primary model introduced in this paper, designed for phylogenetic inference using generative flow networks.
name.quote: In this work, we propose PhyloGFN, the first adaptation of GFlowNets to the task of Bayesian and parsimony-based phylogenetic inference.

type.justification: The model belongs to the generative flow network family, designed for generative tasks over multimodal distributions.
type.quote: Coming from the intersection of variational inference and reinforcement learning is the class of models known as generative flow networks (GFlowNets; Bengio et al., 2021).

name.justification: DS1 is one of the real-world benchmark datasets used in the experiments to evaluate the performance of PhyloGFN.
name.quote: Our PhyloGFN is markedly superior to φ-CSMC across all datasets and outperforms GeoPhy on most, with the exception of DS2 and DS3 where the two perform similarly, and DS7 where GeoPhy obtains a better result.

name.justification: DS2 is one of the datasets on which the performance of PhyloGFN is evaluated in comparison to other methods.
name.quote: Our PhyloGFN is markedly superior to φ-CSMC across all datasets and outperforms GeoPhy on most, with the exception of DS2 and DS3 where the two perform similarly, and DS7 where GeoPhy obtains a better result.

name.justification: DS3 is one of the datasets utilized to demonstrate the effectiveness and competitiveness of PhyloGFN.
name.quote: Our PhyloGFN is markedly superior to φ-CSMC across all datasets and outperforms GeoPhy on most, with the exception of DS2 and DS3 where the two perform similarly, and DS7 where GeoPhy obtains a better result.

name.justification: DS4 is part of the suite of datasets used to benchmark the proposed model, PhyloGFN.
name.quote: PhyloGFN is compared with a variety of baselines in terms of sampling-based estimates of marginal loglikelihood (MLL; see details in §4.4).

name.justification: DS5 is another dataset employed in the empirical evaluation of PhyloGFN.
name.quote: PhyloGFN is compared with a variety of baselines in terms of sampling-based estimates of marginal loglikelihood (MLL; see details in §4.4).

name.justification: DS6 is included in the experimental analysis to assess the performance of PhyloGFN.
name.quote: PhyloGFN is compared with a variety of baselines in terms of sampling-based estimates of marginal loglikelihood (MLL; see details in §4.4).

name.justification: DS7 is part of the datasets on which PhyloGFN's performance is tested and compared with other methods.
name.quote: Our PhyloGFN is markedly superior to φ-CSMC across all datasets and outperforms GeoPhy on most, with the exception of DS2 and DS3 where the two perform similarly, and DS7 where GeoPhy obtains a better result.

name.justification: DS8 is used in the experiments to demonstrate PhyloGFN's effectiveness in phylogenetic inference tasks.
name.quote: PhyloGFN is compared with a variety of baselines in terms of sampling-based estimates of marginal loglikelihood (MLL; see details in §4.4).

name.justification: PyTorch is mentioned as one of the libraries used, likely for implementing and training the deep learning models discussed.
TensorFlow is mentioned as one of the libraries used, likely for implementing and training the deep learning models discussed.
